title: MIT Media Lab Director Resigns Over Epstein Donations
summary: New Yorker article detailed how financier's relationship with MIT was deeper than previously known. The director of the Media Lab at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology resigned following a news report detailing his ties to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epsteinand Mr. Epstein's donations to the esteemed institution.

title: Antonio Brown Signs With New England Patriots
summary: Deal comes the same day that Oakland Raiders released the star receiver. When the Oakland Raiders released Antonio Brown early Saturday, it ended a bizarre saga in which the star wide receiver's troubled partnership with the team ended before he ever played a game for the team.

title: In New Hampshire, Democrats Urge Activists to Pick a New Face
summary: Candidates, taking aim at Biden, warn against picking a conventional challenger to President Trump. MANCHESTER, N.H.-A slate of Democratic presidential hopefuls pressed New Hampshire party activists to embrace a fresh face Saturday, warning of the pitfalls of choosing a conventional challenger to President Trump.

title: Restitution Battle Throws Three-Year-Old Och-Ziff Settlement Into Limbo
summary: The hedge fund has asked a federal judge to reconsider a ruling that gives victim status to former investors in a Congolese mining venture, who say they are owed up to $1.8 billion in restitution. A group of investors in a Congolese mining venture were victims of a bribery scheme involving the hedge fund Och-Ziff Capital Management Group Inc., a federal judge in New York has ruled.

title: Investors Notch Victory Over Fannie, Freddie Profits
summary: An appellate court overturned a ruling that supported a government decision in 2012 to sweep all the mortgage-finance giants' profits to the Treasury Department. WASHINGTON-Investors in Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac notched a win in their yearslong challenge to the U.S. sweep of nearly all of the mortgage-finance giants' profits, a victory in their fight for gains from the companies' return to profitability.

title: Iran Moves to Boost Uranium Stockpile
summary: Move comes after Europe failed to meet a deadline to offset the impact of U.S. sanctions. Iran said Saturday it had accelerated its nuclear research work and threatened to take fresh steps within a month that could allow it to expand its stockpile of enriched uranium, a material that can be used to fuel a nuclear weapon.

title: Deaths Prompt Alert About Vaping Risks
summary: Number of mysterious lung injuries more than doubled from last week. Health authorities are urging people to stop using electronic cigarettes and other vaping products while they investigate three more deaths from a mysterious illness that federal officials say may have affected over 450 users of the devices around the U.S.

title: Serena Williams Goes for History at the U.S. Open
summary: The tennis star is one win away from her 24th Grand Slam title, while 19-year-old Bianca Andreescu aims to play spoiler. Everyone believes this is finally the moment for Serena Williams to win her record-tying 24th major title.

title: Russia, Ukraine Exchange Prisoners
summary: Among the 70 prisoners being exchanged: two dozen Ukrainian sailors, a prominent Ukranian filmmaker and a Russian journalist. MOSCOW-Russia and Ukraine conducted a large-scale prisoner swap, a potential first step toward easing tensions between Moscow and Kiev.

title: The Buck Starts Here: Accounting for Women's Spending Power
summary: As women gain economic clout and spending power, companies must change not just what they sell but how they sell it in order to take advantage.. There is little doubt that women's growing economic power will radically alter the American marketplace. What exactly the consumer landscape will look like, though, and who will benefit, is where things get fuzzy.

title: Baby Unicorns Are Doing a Bit Too Well
summary: Zoom Video and CrowdStrike valuations have become rich, but companies were wise to avoid pre-IPO bloat. Uber , Lyft and WeWork are stellar examples of what can happen when investors cram too much cash into a company ahead of an initial public offering. Zoom Video and CrowdStrike are proving to be the opposite.

title: New York Hits Out-of-Stater With Hefty Tax Bill Over Vacation Home
summary: Judge rules New Jersey resident required to pay New York state taxes on all his income. Hedge-fund manager Nelson Obus liked to stay at his cottage in the Adirondacks during cross-country ski trips. He had no idea how expensive those vacations were until he heard from New York tax collectors.

title: Lantern Festival to Light Up Citi Field
summary: The Hello Panda Festival is billed as a lantern, food and arts extravaganza celebrating Chinese culture and diversity. A producer of Chinese cultural events is planning a seven-week festival at Citi Field this holiday season.

title: 'Far Out: Suits, Habs, and Labs for Outer Space' Review: The Final Frontier for Grievance
summary: An exhibition at the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art looks at the way imagination has shaped our quest for the stars, but also loads interstellar exploration with Earthbound troubles..

title: Landmark Israel-Egypt Energy Alliance Hits Snags
summary: Resume Subscription. CAIRO-A landmark 2018 natural-gas deal between Israel and Egypt faces legal challenges and concerns about security threats from Islamic State, casting uncertainty over a pact hailed as a sign of deepening ties between the two countries.

title: Rafael Nadal, Daniil Medvedev Advance to U.S. Open Men's Final
summary: A victory would give Nadal his 19th career major title. Rafael Nadal needs one more win to put himself within one major title of the all-time record.

title: The Other Immigration Morass: A Battle Over Workers' Green Cards
summary: Roughly 1 million people remain stuck in growing backlog for one of 140,000 employment-based green cards distributed each year. WASHINGTON-When Indian immigrant Jay Indurkar applied for permanent U.S. residency in 2011, he filled out paperwork, passed background checks, showed proof of a job offer in Kansas and was approved for a green card in a matter of weeks.

title: What Matters This Week in the 2020 Race
summary: As Democratic presidential contest intensifies, Joe Biden's lead matters more. For Democrats aspiring to be president, the warm-up lap just ended.

title: Workers Flee Big Cities-and Take Their Jobs With Them
summary: Resume Subscription. Kelly Swift grew tired of the Los Angeles area a few years ago so she decided to leave-and take her job with her.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Why Does My Smartphone Ask Such Dumb Questions?
summary: It would have quizzed Custer on how he enjoyed Little Big Horn.. My smartphone is constantly asking me if I enjoyed my trip to the park or the river walk, scant seconds after I have left. The screen of my electronic Nosy Parker continually flashes with urgent queries about how I enjoyed my coffee, my snack, my gelato. And for some reason, it keeps giving me updates on Chicago White Sox games.

title: In the Race to Dominate 5G, China Sprints Ahead
summary: The super-fast wireless technology is expected to revolutionize everything from driving to surgery. Tongguan, China

title: How Qualcomm's President Changes His Perspective
summary: Cristiano Amon shares the trusted advisers he turns to when thinking about the future.

title: T-Mobile's CEO and the Tribal Approach to Management
summary: John Legere savages T-Mobile's competitors in a singular approach that has won him the devotion of his employees. Officially speaking, John Legere is the chief executive of T-Mobile, the $68 billion wireless carrier. Unofficially, the 61-year-old telecom veteran has another title.

title: Hurricane Dorian Drenches Outer Banks, Leaves Some Residents Stranded
summary: Utilities report power outages in Carolinas, Virginia as Category 1 storm edges north. WILMINGTON, N.C.-Hurricane Dorian flooded homes and knocked out power Friday in North Carolina as the storm concluded a week-long tear along the Southeast coastline.
